explanation: Agent A's report is correct. In the excerpt there is no provable, visible guarantee that hdr_name.str / hdr_value.str point to NUL-terminated objects within their allocated bounds prior to the calls to strlen. strlen scans until a NUL and therefore may read past the end of the object if the NUL is not present within the allocation — an access pattern that Rule 21.17 forbids. The code only uses runtime assertions (mhd_assert) to check for NULL and to assert that strlen(...) == len; those checks do not prevent the potentially out-of-bounds read that strlen itself performs, and mhd_assert may be compiled out, so they do not provide the static/bound guarantee required by MISRA. If get_req_header has an externally documented, provable contract that the returned pointer/length pair is always NUL-terminated within the buffer bounds, then the use of strlen would be acceptable; but no such guarantee is visible here, so the reported violation is valid. Recommended fixes include: ensure get_req_header documents/ensures NUL-termination within bounds, or avoid strlen and use a bounded scan (e.g. memchr with hdr_value.len) or otherwise validate within hdr_value.len before calling string functions.
